intro: Clidemia purpurea, commonly known as purple mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Clidemia purpurea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
